funtest.testharness.core.utils.io

Class VariableReplaceInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • funtest.testharness.core.utils.io.VariableReplaceInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class VariableReplaceInputStream
extends InputStream

    Class provides an input stream that will perform variable and function replacing in a stream.

    Variables

    Variable substitution is performed by matching the begin and end delimiters specified at object construction. If none are supplied then DEFAULT_BEGIN_DELIM ("${") and DEFAULT_END_DELIM ("}"). The string between these delimiters is then used as the key for the supplied Properties object and this value will be used as the replacement.
    For example given a properties object with the following key value pair:
    var1 => VARIABLE_1
    and original string:
    String with ${var1} in it
    would result in string:
    String with VARIABLE_1 in it

    Functions

    Function substitution is performed in the same way as variable substitution, however to distinguish between function and variable the function name will start with an underscore(_) and end with parenthesis. The function name is then mapped to an implementation of the Function interface and the Function.execute(String...) method is called. The parameters are comma seperated and passed to the function as a String array. For example we have a SubString Class that implements the Function interface. This takes three parameters, the first is the original string, the second is the start delimiter and the third is the end delimiter. Therefore to call this we would use (using default delimiters and noting the relevance of the spaces):
    This is a string with ${_substring(this is a test string,this is , string)} function in it
    and the function would return:
    a test
    and the InputStream would result in:
    This is a string with a test function in it
    Author:
    codersparks
